tools.name: get_range_values
tools.description: Read cell values from a specified range. Returns a 2D array of the displayed values (not formulas). Use get_range_formulas instead if you need to inspect formulas. Use maxRows/maxColumns to limit the response size on large ranges, and startRow/startColumn to page through data.

sheetName.description: Optional worksheet name. Uses active sheet if omitted.

maxRows.description: Maximum number of rows to return. Omit to return all rows. Use with startRow to page through large ranges.

maxColumns.description: Maximum number of columns to return. Omit to return all columns. Use with startColumn to page through wide ranges.

startRow.description: 1-based row offset within the range to start reading from. Defaults to 1 (first row). Use with maxRows to read subsequent pages.

startColumn.description: 1-based column offset within the range to start reading from. Defaults to 1 (first column). Use with maxColumns to read subsequent pages.

tools.name: set_range_values
tools.description: Write values to a specified range, overwriting any existing content. Values must be a 2D array matching the range dimensions. Use set_range_formulas for formulas.

values.description: 2D array of values to write (rows × columns)

tools.name: get_used_range
tools.description: Get the bounding rectangle of all non-empty cells on a worksheet. By default returns only the address and dimensions (rowCount, columnCount) — no cell values. Set maxRows to include values for the first N rows (e.g., maxRows=5 to preview headers and a few data rows). Use startRow/startColumn/maxColumns to page through large sheets in 2D. Use get_range_values to read a specific sub-range when you already know the address.

sheetName.description: Optional worksheet name. Uses active sheet if omitted.

maxRows.description: How many rows of cell values to include in the response. Omit to get dimensions only (no values). Set to a small number like 5 to preview headers + a few data rows, saving tokens on large sheets.

maxColumns.description: Maximum number of columns to return per row. Omit to return all columns. Use with startColumn to page through wide sheets.

startRow.description: 1-based row offset to start reading from. Defaults to 1. Use with maxRows to read subsequent row pages.

startColumn.description: 1-based column offset to start reading from. Defaults to 1. Use with maxColumns to read subsequent column pages.

tools.name: clear_range
tools.description: Clear all content (values, formulas, and formatting) from a specified range. The cells remain but become empty.

tools.name: format_range
tools.description: Apply visual formatting to a range of cells. Only set the properties you want to change — omitted properties are left unchanged. Supports bold, italic, underline, font size, font color, fill/background color, horizontal alignment, and text wrapping. For number display formats (currency, dates, percent), use set_number_format instead.

fontColor.description: Font color as hex (e.g., "#FF0000" for red) or named color

fillColor.description: Cell background/fill color as hex (e.g., "#FFFF00" for yellow)

tools.name: set_number_format
tools.description: Apply a number format to a range. Common formats: "#,##0.00" (number), "$#,##0.00" (currency), "0.00%" (percent), "yyyy-mm-dd" (date), "0" (integer).

tools.name: auto_fit_columns
tools.description: Auto-fit column widths to fit their content. If no address is specified, fits all used columns.

address.description: Optional range address. Columns in this range will be auto-fitted.

tools.name: auto_fit_rows
tools.description: Auto-fit row heights to fit their content. If no address is specified, fits all used rows.

address.description: Optional range address. Rows in this range will be auto-fitted.

tools.name: set_range_formulas
tools.description: Write Excel formulas to cells. Formulas must start with "=" (e.g., "=SUM(A1:A10)").

tools.name: get_range_formulas
tools.description: Read the formulas from a range. Returns formulas as strings (cells without formulas return their value).

tools.name: sort_range
tools.description: Sort a range of cells in-place by a specified column. Best for ad-hoc data ranges. For structured Excel tables, use sort_table instead.

column.description: Zero-based column index to sort by (0 = first column)

ascending.description: Sort ascending (true) or descending (false). Default true.

hasHeaders.description: First row is a header row. Default true.

tools.name: auto_fill_range
tools.description: Auto-fill a pattern from a source range into a destination range. Useful for extending formulas, dates, or sequences.

tools.name: flash_fill_range
tools.description: Apply Flash Fill to a range based on adjacent data patterns (Excel-detected extraction/transformation pattern).

tools.name: get_special_cells
tools.description: Get a RangeAreas result containing only special cells in a range (e.g., blanks, formulas, constants, visible cells, conditional formats).

tools.name: get_range_precedents
tools.description: Get direct precedent cells (cells referenced by formulas) for a range as cross-sheet addresses.

tools.name: get_range_dependents
tools.description: Get direct dependent cells (formulas that reference this range) as cross-sheet addresses.

address.description: Range whose dependents should be found (e.g., "B2")

tools.name: recalculate_range
tools.description: Force recalculation for formulas in a specific range.

tools.name: get_tables_for_range
tools.description: List tables that overlap (or are fully contained in) a given range.

address.description: Range address to check for intersecting tables (e.g., "A1:H500")

fullyContained.description: If true, only include tables fully contained in the range. Default false (any overlap).

tools.name: copy_range
tools.description: Copy values, formulas, and formatting from a source range to a destination range. Supports copying across worksheets by specifying sourceSheet and destinationSheet.

sourceSheet.description: Source worksheet name. Uses active sheet if omitted.

destinationSheet.description: Destination worksheet name. Uses active sheet if omitted.

tools.name: find_values
tools.description: Search for text or a value across all cells in a worksheet. Returns the cell address and value of the first match, or a "not found" message if no match exists.

searchText.description: The text or value to search for

matchEntireCell.description: Match the entire cell content. Default false.

tools.name: insert_range
tools.description: Insert blank cells at the specified address, shifting existing cells down or right to make room. Use row notation (e.g., "3:5") to insert entire rows, column notation (e.g., "B:D") for entire columns, or a cell range for a block.

address.description: Range address where blank cells will be inserted (e.g., "3:5" for rows 3-5, "B:D" for columns B-D, "A1:C3" for a block)

shift.description: Direction to shift existing cells. Default "down".

tools.name: delete_range
tools.description: Delete cells at the specified address, shifting remaining cells up or left to fill the gap. Use row notation (e.g., "3:5") to delete entire rows, column notation (e.g., "B:D") for entire columns, or a cell range for a block. Data in deleted cells is permanently removed.

address.description: Range address to delete (e.g., "3:5" for rows 3-5, "B:D" for columns, "A1:C3" for a block)

shift.description: Direction to shift remaining cells. Default "up".

tools.name: merge_cells
tools.description: Merge a range of cells into a single cell. WARNING: Only the upper-left cell's value is preserved; values in all other cells are discarded. Use the "across" option to merge each row separately (e.g., for header rows that span columns).

across.description: Merge each row independently (merge across). Default false.

tools.name: unmerge_cells
tools.description: Unmerge a previously merged range of cells.

tools.name: replace_values
tools.description: Find and replace text across a range or the entire used range on a sheet. Returns the number of replacements made.

address.description: Range to search in (e.g., "A1:C10"). If omitted, searches the entire used range.

tools.name: remove_duplicates
tools.description: Remove duplicate rows from a range based on specified columns. Returns the number of rows removed and remaining.

columns.description: Zero-based column indices to compare for duplicates (e.g., ["0","2"] for columns A and C). Pass all column indices to check entire rows.

tools.name: set_hyperlink
tools.description: Set or remove a hyperlink on a single cell. Supports web URLs, email addresses, and links to other cells within the workbook.

url.description: The hyperlink URL or cell reference (e.g., "https://example.com", "mailto:x@y.com", "Sheet2!A1"). Use "" to remove.

textToDisplay.description: Display text for the hyperlink. If omitted, the URL is shown.

tools.name: toggle_row_column_visibility
tools.description: Hide or show rows and/or columns in a range. Hidden rows/columns are not visible in the UI but their data is preserved.

address.description: Range specifying which rows/columns to affect (e.g., "A:C" for columns A-C, "3:5" for rows 3-5, "B2:D10" for specific rows and columns)

hidden.description: True to hide, false to show

tools.name: group_rows_columns
tools.description: Group rows or columns to create an outline for expanding/collapsing sections.

address.description: Range of rows or columns to group (e.g., "3:5" for rows 3-5, "B:D" for columns B-D)

tools.name: ungroup_rows_columns
tools.description: Remove a grouping from rows or columns.

address.description: Range of grouped rows or columns to ungroup

tools.name: set_cell_borders
tools.description: Apply borders to a range. Specify which sides to apply borders to and the style.

address.description: The range address to apply borders to

borderColor.description: Border color as hex (e.g., "#000000" for black)

side.description: Which side(s) to apply border to

tools.name: list_tables
tools.description: List all structured Excel tables. Returns each table's name, address range, worksheet name, column names, and row count. Optionally filter to a specific sheet.

sheetName.description: Optional: filter to tables on a specific sheet.

tools.name: create_table
tools.description: Convert a data range into a structured Excel table with sorting, filtering, and styled formatting. The range should include a header row by default.

hasHeaders.description: Whether the first row contains headers. Default true.

tools.name: add_table_rows
tools.description: Append new rows to the bottom of an existing Excel table. Each row must have the same number of columns as the table.

tableName.description: Name of the table to add rows to

values.description: 2D array of row data to add

tools.name: get_table_data
tools.description: Read all data from an Excel table. Returns the column headers and all row values as a 2D array. Use list_tables first to discover available table names.

tableName.description: Name of the table to read

tools.name: delete_table
tools.description: Remove the Excel table structure (sorting, filtering, styling) from a range. The underlying cell data is preserved — only the table object is removed.

tableName.description: Name of the table to delete

tools.name: sort_table
tools.description: Sort a structured Excel table by a column in ascending or descending order. For ad-hoc data ranges that are not tables, use sort_range instead.

tableName.description: Name of the table to sort

column.description: Zero-based column index to sort by (0 = first column)

ascending.description: Sort ascending (true) or descending (false). Default true.

tools.name: filter_table
tools.description: Apply a values filter to a table column, hiding rows that don't match. Only rows with values matching any of the specified filter values will be visible. Use clear_table_filters to remove all filters.

tableName.description: Name of the table to filter

column.description: Zero-based column index to filter (0 = first column)

values.description: Array of values to show (rows matching any of these are kept)

tools.name: clear_table_filters
tools.description: Clear all filters from an Excel table, showing all rows.

tableName.description: Name of the table to clear filters from

tools.name: add_table_column
tools.description: Add a new column to the end of a table.

columnName.description: Optional column header name. If omitted, Excel generates a default name.

columnData.description: Optional array of values for the new column (one per data row)

tools.name: delete_table_column
tools.description: Delete a column from a table.

columnName.description: Name of the column to delete

tools.name: convert_table_to_range
tools.description: Convert a structured table back to a plain range (removes table formatting).

tableName.description: Name of the table to convert

tools.name: resize_table
tools.description: Resize a table to a new range address. The new range must overlap the existing table and keep a valid table shape.

tableName.description: Name of the table to resize

tools.name: set_table_style
tools.description: Set or change a table style (e.g., "TableStyleMedium2").

tools.name: set_table_header_totals_visibility
tools.description: Show or hide table header row and totals row.

tools.name: reapply_table_filters
tools.description: Reapply existing filters on a table after data changes.

tools.name: list_charts
tools.description: List all charts on a worksheet. Returns each chart's name, type, and title. Uses the active sheet if no sheet is specified.

sheetName.description: Worksheet name. Uses active sheet if omitted.

tools.name: create_chart
tools.description: Create a new chart from a data range and place it on the same worksheet. The data range should include headers for proper axis labels and legend.

dataRange.description: Range address of the source data (e.g., "A1:D10")

sheetName.description: Optional worksheet name for the source data.

tools.name: delete_chart
tools.description: Delete a chart from the worksheet.

chartName.description: Name of the chart to delete (from list_charts)

sheetName.description: Optional worksheet name where the chart is located.

tools.name: set_chart_title
tools.description: Set or change the title of a chart.

tools.name: set_chart_type
tools.description: Change the chart type (e.g., from column to pie).

tools.name: set_chart_data_source
tools.description: Change the data range that a chart is based on.

tools.name: set_chart_position
tools.description: Position and size a chart. Use startCell/endCell to anchor by range, or left/top/width/height for point-based positioning.

tools.name: set_chart_legend_visibility
tools.description: Show or hide the chart legend.

tools.name: set_chart_axis_title
tools.description: Set the axis title text for a chart axis and make the title visible.

tools.name: set_chart_axis_visibility
tools.description: Show or hide a chart axis.

tools.name: set_chart_series_filtered
tools.description: Set whether an individual chart series is filtered (hidden) by index.

filtered.description: True to hide series, false to show series

tools.name: list_sheets
tools.description: List all worksheets in the workbook. Returns each sheet's name, position, visibility status, and whether it is the active sheet.

tools.name: create_sheet
tools.description: Create a new blank worksheet and add it to the workbook. The sheet becomes the active sheet.

tools.name: rename_sheet
tools.description: Rename an existing worksheet.

tools.name: delete_sheet
tools.description: Permanently delete a worksheet and all its data from the workbook. This cannot be undone.

name.description: Name of the worksheet to delete

tools.name: activate_sheet
tools.description: Activate (switch to) a specific worksheet.

name.description: Name of the worksheet to activate

tools.name: freeze_panes
tools.description: Freeze rows and/or columns on a worksheet so they remain visible when scrolling. Specify a cell address to freeze all rows above and columns to the left of that cell. Use "unfreeze" to remove all frozen panes.

freezeAt.description: Cell address to freeze at (e.g., "B3" freezes row 1-2 and column A). Omit to unfreeze all panes.

tools.name: protect_sheet
tools.description: Protect a worksheet to prevent editing. Optionally provide a password. Protected sheets block cell edits, row/column insertions, and other modifications.

name.description: Name of the worksheet to protect

password.description: Optional password to protect the sheet with

tools.name: unprotect_sheet
tools.description: Remove protection from a worksheet. Provide the password if one was set.

name.description: Name of the worksheet to unprotect

tools.name: set_sheet_visibility
tools.description: Set sheet visibility (visible, hidden, or very hidden) and/or tab color. Very hidden sheets cannot be unhidden from the Excel UI — only via code.

tabColor.description: Tab color as a hex string (e.g., "#FF0000" for red). Use "" to clear.

tools.name: copy_sheet
tools.description: Create a copy of a worksheet. The copy is placed after the source sheet by default.

name.description: Name of the worksheet to copy

newName.description: Name for the copied sheet. If omitted, Excel generates a default name.

tools.name: move_sheet
tools.description: Move a worksheet to a new position in the workbook. Position is 0-based (0 = first).

name.description: Name of the worksheet to move

tools.name: set_page_layout
tools.description: Configure page layout settings for printing: orientation (portrait/landscape), margins, paper size.

tools.name: set_sheet_gridlines
tools.description: Show or hide worksheet gridlines for a specific sheet.

showGridlines.description: True to show gridlines, false to hide

tools.name: set_sheet_headings
tools.description: Show or hide row/column headings (A, B, C and 1, 2, 3) for a worksheet.

showHeadings.description: True to show row/column headings, false to hide

tools.name: recalculate_sheet
tools.description: Force recalculation of formulas on a specific worksheet. Defaults to full recalculation.

tools.name: get_workbook_info
tools.description: Get a high-level overview of the entire workbook. Returns all sheet names, the active sheet, the used range dimensions of the active sheet, a list of all table names, and counts. This is the best starting point to understand what data exists before performing operations.

tools.name: get_selected_range
tools.description: Get the address and values of the range the user currently has selected (highlighted) in Excel. Useful when the user says "this data", "selected cells", or "what I have highlighted".

tools.name: define_named_range
tools.description: Create a named range — a human-readable alias for a cell range (e.g., "SalesData" → Sheet1!A1:D100). Named ranges make formulas more readable and can be used in formulas across the workbook.

comment.description: Optional comment describing the named range.

tools.name: list_named_ranges
tools.description: List all named ranges defined in the workbook. Returns each name, the range address it refers to, and any comment.

tools.name: recalculate_workbook
tools.description: Force a full recalculation of all formulas in the entire workbook.

tools.name: save_workbook
tools.description: Save the current workbook. Optionally prompt the user before saving.

tools.name: get_workbook_properties
tools.description: Get workbook document properties such as title, author, subject, and category.

tools.name: set_workbook_properties
tools.description: Set workbook document properties such as title, author, subject, category, and keywords.

tools.name: get_workbook_protection
tools.description: Get current workbook protection state.

tools.name: protect_workbook
tools.description: Protect the workbook structure. Optionally provide a password.

tools.name: unprotect_workbook
tools.description: Remove workbook protection. Provide password if one was set.

tools.name: refresh_data_connections
tools.description: Refresh all workbook data connections supported by the Excel data connection API.

tools.name: list_queries
tools.description: List all Power Query queries in the workbook. Returns query name, load target type, whether it loads to data model, last refresh time, rows loaded, and latest error status.

tools.name: get_query
tools.description: Get details for a single Power Query query by name. Returns load target type, data-model loading flag, last refresh time, rows loaded, and latest error status.

queryName.description: Name of the Power Query query to retrieve (case-insensitive).

tools.name: get_query_count
tools.description: Get the number of Power Query queries in the workbook.

tools.name: add_comment
tools.description: Add a threaded comment to a specific cell. The comment appears in the Comments pane and is attributed to the current user. Only one comment thread per cell is allowed.

cellAddress.description: The single cell address to attach the comment to (e.g., "A1", "B5")

tools.name: list_comments
tools.description: List all comments on a worksheet. Returns each comment's text, author, creation date, and cell address.

sheetName.description: Optional worksheet name. Uses active sheet if omitted.

tools.name: edit_comment
tools.description: Edit the text of an existing comment on a specific cell. Replaces the entire comment content.

cellAddress.description: The cell address of the comment to edit (e.g., "A1")

newText.description: The new text for the comment

tools.name: delete_comment
tools.description: Delete a comment and all its replies from a specific cell.

cellAddress.description: The cell address of the comment to delete (e.g., "A1")

tools.name: add_color_scale
tools.description: Add a color scale (gradient) conditional format to a range. Cells are colored on a gradient from minColor (lowest value) through optional midColor to maxColor (highest value).

tools.name: add_data_bar
tools.description: Add data bars to cells, showing a horizontal bar whose length represents the cell value relative to other cells in the range.

tools.name: add_cell_value_format
tools.description: Add conditional formatting based on cell numeric values. Highlight cells that meet a condition (e.g., greater than 100, between 0 and 50).

fontColor.description: Font color when condition is met (e.g., "#FF0000").

fillColor.description: Fill color when condition is met (e.g., "#00FF00").

tools.name: add_top_bottom_format
tools.description: Highlight the top or bottom N items (or percent) in a range. For example, highlight the top 10 values or the bottom 25%.

fillColor.description: Fill color for highlighted items. Default "green".

tools.name: add_contains_text_format
tools.description: Highlight cells that contain specific text. For example, highlight all cells containing "Error" in red.

text.description: The text to search for in cells

fontColor.description: Font color for matching cells. Default "red".

tools.name: add_custom_format
tools.description: Add a custom formula-based conditional format. The formula must evaluate to TRUE for the formatting to apply. For example, "=A1>B1" to highlight cells where column A exceeds column B.

formula.description: Excel formula that evaluates to TRUE/FALSE (e.g., "=A1>B1")

fontColor.description: Font color when formula is TRUE.

fillColor.description: Fill color when formula is TRUE.

tools.name: list_conditional_formats
tools.description: List all conditional formatting rules applied to a range. Returns each rule's type, priority, and stopIfTrue setting.

tools.name: clear_conditional_formats
tools.description: Remove all conditional formatting rules from a range, or from the entire sheet if no address is specified.

address.description: Optional range address. If omitted, clears the entire sheet.

tools.name: set_list_validation
tools.description: Set a dropdown list validation on a range. Users will see a dropdown with the specified values. Use comma-separated values or a range reference as the source.

source.description: Comma-separated values or a range reference (e.g., "Yes,No,Maybe" or "=Sheet2!A1:A5")

inCellDropDown.description: Show a dropdown in the cell. Default true.

errorMessage.description: Error message shown when invalid data is entered.

errorTitle.description: Title of the error alert dialog. Default "Invalid Input".

promptMessage.description: Help message shown when the cell is selected.

promptTitle.description: Title of the input prompt. Default "Input Help".

tools.name: set_number_validation
tools.description: Restrict cell input to whole numbers or decimals matching a condition (e.g., greater than 0, between 1 and 100).

numberType.description: Whether to allow whole numbers or decimals.

errorMessage.description: Error message shown when invalid data is entered.

errorTitle.description: Title of the error alert dialog. Default "Invalid Input".

promptMessage.description: Help message shown when the cell is selected.

promptTitle.description: Title of the input prompt. Default "Input Help".

tools.name: set_date_validation
tools.description: Restrict cell input to dates matching a condition (e.g., after 2024-01-01, between two dates).

errorMessage.description: Error message shown when invalid data is entered.

errorTitle.description: Title of the error alert dialog. Default "Invalid Input".

promptMessage.description: Help message shown when the cell is selected.

promptTitle.description: Title of the input prompt. Default "Input Help".

tools.name: set_text_length_validation
tools.description: Restrict cell input based on text length (e.g., maximum 100 characters, between 5 and 50 characters).

errorMessage.description: Error message shown when invalid data is entered.

errorTitle.description: Title of the error alert dialog. Default "Invalid Input".

promptMessage.description: Help message shown when the cell is selected.

promptTitle.description: Title of the input prompt. Default "Input Help".

tools.name: set_custom_validation
tools.description: Set a custom formula-based validation rule. The formula must evaluate to TRUE for the input to be accepted (e.g., "=LEN(A1)<=100").

formula.description: Excel formula that must evaluate to TRUE (e.g., "=LEN(A1)<=100")

errorMessage.description: Error message shown when invalid data is entered.

errorTitle.description: Title of the error alert dialog. Default "Invalid Input".

promptMessage.description: Help message shown when the cell is selected.

promptTitle.description: Title of the input prompt. Default "Input Help".

tools.name: get_data_validation
tools.description: Get the data validation rule currently applied to a range. Returns the rule type, rule details, error alert, and prompt configuration.

tools.name: clear_data_validation
tools.description: Remove all data validation rules from a range, allowing any input.

address.description: The range address to clear validation from (e.g., "B2:B100")

tools.name: list_pivot_tables
tools.description: List all PivotTables on a worksheet. Returns each PivotTable's name plus row/column/filter/data hierarchy names.

sheetName.description: Optional worksheet name. Uses active sheet if omitted.

tools.name: refresh_pivot_table
tools.description: Refresh a PivotTable to reflect changes in its source data.

pivotTableName.description: Name of the PivotTable to refresh

tools.name: refresh_all_pivot_tables
tools.description: Refresh all PivotTables. If sheetName is provided, refreshes PivotTables on that worksheet; otherwise refreshes all workbook PivotTables.

sheetName.description: Optional worksheet name to scope refresh to one sheet.

tools.name: get_pivot_table_source_info
tools.description: Get PivotTable source metadata, including source type and source address/connection string when available.

tools.name: get_pivot_hierarchy_counts
tools.description: Get counts of row, column, filter, and data hierarchies currently configured on a PivotTable.

tools.name: get_pivot_hierarchies
tools.description: List row, column, filter, and data hierarchies for a PivotTable including names and ids.

tools.name: set_pivot_table_options
tools.description: Set PivotTable behavior options such as multiple filters per field, custom sort lists, refresh on open, and data value editing.

allowMultipleFiltersPerField.description: Allow multiple filters (for different filter types) on the same PivotField

useCustomSortLists.description: Use workbook custom sort lists when sorting PivotFields

refreshOnOpen.description: Refresh this PivotTable when the workbook opens

enableDataValueEditing.description: Enable editing of data values directly in the PivotTable when supported

tools.name: delete_pivot_table
tools.description: Delete a PivotTable from the worksheet.

pivotTableName.description: Name of the PivotTable to delete

tools.name: create_pivot_table
tools.description: Create a new PivotTable from a data range. Specify which fields go into rows and values. Value fields default to SUM aggregation.

sourceAddress.description: Source data range with headers (e.g., "Sheet1!A1:D100"). Must include column headers in the first row.

destinationAddress.description: Top-left cell where the PivotTable should be placed (e.g., "Sheet2!A1"). Must be on a different area from the source.

rowFields.description: Column names to use as row labels (e.g., ["Region", "Category"])

valueFields.description: Column names to aggregate as values (e.g., ["Sales", "Quantity"])

sourceSheetName.description: Sheet containing the source data. Uses active sheet if omitted.

destinationSheetName.description: Sheet for the PivotTable output. Uses active sheet if omitted.

tools.name: add_pivot_field
tools.description: Add a field to a pivot table as a row field, column field, data field, or filter field.

fieldName.description: Name of the source data column to add as a field

fieldType.description: Where to add the field in the pivot layout

tools.name: set_pivot_layout
tools.description: Set PivotTable layout and display options such as layout type, subtotal placement, field headers, and grand totals.

pivotTableName.description: Name of the PivotTable to configure

showFieldHeaders.description: Show or hide pivot field headers

showRowGrandTotals.description: Show or hide row grand totals

showColumnGrandTotals.description: Show or hide column grand totals

tools.name: get_pivot_field_filters
tools.description: Get active filter state for a PivotField, including whether any/date/label/manual/value filters are currently set.

fieldName.description: Name of the PivotField (source column name)

tools.name: get_pivot_field_items
tools.description: List PivotItems for a PivotField, including item names, ids, and expand state.

fieldName.description: Name of the PivotField (source column name)

tools.name: clear_pivot_field_filters
tools.description: Clear filters on a PivotField. If filterType is omitted, clears all filters; otherwise clears only the specified filter type.

fieldName.description: Name of the PivotField (source column name)

filterType.description: Optional filter type to clear; omit to clear all filter types.

tools.name: apply_pivot_label_filter
tools.description: Apply a label filter to a PivotField. Provide condition and value1; optionally provide value2 for Between/NotBetween conditions.

fieldName.description: Name of the PivotField (source column name)

value2.description: Optional secondary comparator value for Between/NotBetween conditions

exclusive.description: Optional flag for exclusive boundary behavior where supported

tools.name: sort_pivot_field_labels
tools.description: Sort PivotField labels in ascending or descending order.

fieldName.description: Name of the PivotField (source column name)

tools.name: apply_pivot_manual_filter
tools.description: Apply a manual item filter to a PivotField by explicitly selecting visible item names.

fieldName.description: Name of the PivotField (source column name)

selectedItems.description: Pivot item names to keep visible for this field

tools.name: sort_pivot_field_values
tools.description: Sort a PivotField by data values for a specified value hierarchy (measure). Optionally scope sort to a pivot item.

fieldName.description: Name of the PivotField (source column name)

valuesHierarchyName.description: Name of the data hierarchy/measure to sort by

pivotItemScope.description: Optional pivot item name to scope value sort

tools.name: set_pivot_field_show_all_items
tools.description: Set whether a PivotField shows all items, including those with no data.

fieldName.description: Name of the PivotField (source column name)

showAllItems.description: Whether to show all items for the field

tools.name: get_pivot_layout_ranges
tools.description: Get key PivotLayout range addresses (table, row labels, column labels, data body, and filter axis when available).

tools.name: set_pivot_layout_display_options
tools.description: Configure PivotLayout display and formatting behavior such as repeat labels, blank lines, auto-format, empty-cell text, and accessibility text.

repeatAllItemLabels.description: Repeat item labels across all pivot fields

displayBlankLineAfterEachItem.description: Display a blank line after each pivot item across fields

autoFormat.description: Auto-apply formatting when refreshed or fields move

fillEmptyCells.description: Fill empty pivot cells using emptyCellText

emptyCellText.description: Text used when fillEmptyCells is enabled

altTextTitle.description: Accessibility alt text title for the PivotTable

altTextDescription.description: Accessibility alt text description for the PivotTable

tools.name: get_pivot_data_hierarchy_for_cell
tools.description: Get the DataPivotHierarchy (measure) used to compute a specific cell in the PivotTable data body.

cellAddress.description: Single cell address inside the PivotTable data body (e.g., "B5")

tools.name: get_pivot_items_for_cell
tools.description: Get PivotItems from a specified axis that contribute to a PivotTable data-body cell value.

axis.description: Pivot axis to inspect for contributing items

cellAddress.description: Single cell address inside the PivotTable data body (e.g., "B5")

tools.name: set_pivot_layout_auto_sort_on_cell
tools.description: Apply PivotTable autosort using a specific pivot data-body cell as context (equivalent to UI autosort behavior).

cellAddress.description: Single cell address inside the PivotTable data body used as autosort context

tools.name: get_pivot_table_count
tools.description: Get the PivotTable count for a worksheet or for the entire workbook when no sheet is provided.

sheetName.description: Optional worksheet name. If omitted, counts PivotTables in the workbook.

tools.name: pivot_table_exists
tools.description: Check whether a PivotTable exists by name on a worksheet or across workbook PivotTables.

pivotTableName.description: Name of the PivotTable to check

tools.name: get_pivot_table_location
tools.description: Get PivotTable worksheet name and layout range address for a named PivotTable on a worksheet.

tools.name: remove_pivot_field
tools.description: Remove a field from a pivot table.

fieldName.description: Name of the field to remove

fieldType.description: Location of the field in the pivot layout
